document.docAuthor: Majka, Christopher G. & Johnson, Paul J.
document.masterDocTitle: The Elateridae (Coleoptera) of the Maritime Provinces of Canada: faunal composition, new records, and taxonomic changes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Elateridae (Coleoptera) of the Maritime Provinces of Canada: faunal composition, new records, and taxonomic changes

subSubSection.paragraph:
This adventive, Palaearctic species was reported from New Brunswick by
Bousquet ( 1991 )
, however, there are no voucher specimens in any collection examined, nor does
Becker ( 1974 )
list it from the province. Accordingly, the species is removed from the faunal list of New Brunswick.

PRINCE EDWARD ISLAND : Prince Co.:
Conway Narrows,
12 .viii. 1970
, U. Grigg, NSMC . Newly recorded from Prince Edward Island. Larvae of species of
Athous
are found in forest litter or decaying logs (
Becker 1974
) where they are predators.

NEW BRUNSWICK : York Co.:
Fredericton,
1992â€“1995
, potato field,
Boiteau et al. ( 2000 )
.

Worthy of attention is
Boiteau et al. 's ( 2000 )
record of this species from New Brunswick. Although not indicated as such in the paper, this was a new record for this species not only in New Brunswick but in the Maritime Provinces as a whole.

NOVA SCOTIA : Cumberland Co.:
Little River,
22 .vii. 2004
, D. McDonald , flight intercept trap, ( 3 ), NSNR .

Newly recorded in Nova Scotia and the Maritime Provinces as a whole. Larvae of species of
Athous
are found in forest litter or decaying logs (
Becker 1974
) where they are predators.

Newly recorded in Nova Scotia . Worthy of attention is
Boiteau et al. 's ( 2000 )
record of this species from New Brunswick. Although not indicated as such in the paper, this was a new record for this species in New Brunswick. Larvae of species of
Athous
are found in forest litter or decaying logs (
Becker 1974
) where they are predators.

subSubSection.paragraph:
PRINCE EDWARD ISLAND : Queens Co.:
Flat River,
6 .viii. 1966
, A. MacKenzie, UPEI .

Newly recorded from Prince Edward Island. Usually collected under spruce (
Picea
sp.) and pine (
Pinus
sp.) bark (
Brooks 1960
). Larvae are in underground portions of decaying logs, stumps and snags, and are voracious predators on immature Buprestidae , Cerambycidae , Tenebrionidae , Scarabaeidae , and probably other insects (unpublished data).

NOVA SCOTIA : Kings Co.:
Kentville,
26 .vii. 1972
, D.H. Webster, near greenhouse, DHWC .
